words.def: ditch dug as a fortification and usually filled with water
(physics and chemistry) the smallest component of an element having the chemical properties of the element
(ethnic slur) offensive and derogatory name for a Black man who is abjectly servile and deferential to Whites
a woolen cap of Scottish origin
extinct flightless bird of New Zealand
a thick flat pad used as a floor covering
annual grass of Europe and North Africa
an adherent of any branch of Taoism
a highly unstable radioactive element (the heaviest of the halogen series)
Toward a closed, touching or engaging position.
a hard grey lustrous metallic element that is highly resistant to corrosion
